thread.title: CPAC Audience Tells Hannity CNN Was 'Worst' News Outlet During Election
thread.title_full: CPAC Audience Tells Hannity CNN Was 'Worst' News Outlet During Election

author: Washington Free Beacon Staff
title: CPAC Audience Tells Hannity CNN Was 'Worst' News Outlet During Election
text:
Share Tweet Email BY: Washington Free Beacon Staff 
February 23, 2017 11:25 am 
Fox News host Sean Hannity taped his show Wednesday at the Conservative Political Action Conference and discovered quickly which media outlet activists there dislike the most.
"Of all the media outlets, which one was the worst?" Hannity asked the audience.
"CNN!" the crowd shouted in response.
Hannity first got the audience fired up during his opening monologue by discussing what he called the media's liberal bias.
"I will tell you right now that the lying corrupt media that never vetted Obama, that never told you the truth about Obama, the lying liberal media that never told you the truth about Hillary," he said.
The conservative radio and television host then brought up WikiLeaks to illustrate his point.
"How bad was the WikiLeaks revelations that showed a media colluding with the campaign of Hillary Clinton to try and undermine then-candidate Donald Trump," he said.
Hannity then told the audience that the WikiLeaks document dumps during the campaign showed how "corrupt" the media is.
"It is the single most corrupt revealing moment about media bias disinformation propaganda distortion and outright lies that they're willing to tell," he said.
The crowd then shouted "fake news," with Hannity egging on the chants.
"The media is against our president,” he said. “We have Democrats against the president. We have freaky weird snowflakes against the president. And we even have weak Republicans against the president."
CPAC started on Wednesday and will run through Saturday at the Gaylord National Resort & Convention Center in National Harbor, Maryland.
  Culture and tagged CNN , Media Bias
